title: A Guide to Check the History on Your Computer: Internet and File History

steps.title: Open a web browser.
steps.content: Open a web browser . This might not be the default web browser on your computer, so look for Microsoft Edge, Google Chrome , Mozilla, or other web browsers.

steps.title: Click the menu icon.
steps.content: Click the menu icon. The appearance of this menu icon is different between browsers. For example, Chrome has ⋮ , Firefox has ☰ , and Microsoft Edge has an icon that looks like a star with three lines coming out of it. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Click History.
steps.content: Click History . In Firefox, you'll need to hover your mouse over Library to see this option. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Review your browsing history.
steps.content: Review your browsing history. If you're using Firefox, click Show All History . The pages visited and the searches initiated should be separated by date.

steps.title: Open the Run app.
steps.content: Open the Run app. Press the Windows key and type "Run" to search for the program. Click the app from the search results to open it.

steps.title: Type "Recent" and press Enter.
steps.content: Type "Recent" and press Enter . A File Explorer window will open to show you a list of recent files that have been edited. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Review the list.
steps.content: Review the list. You'll see categories like the file's name, date modified, type, and size.

steps.title: Press ⊞ Win+I.
steps.content: Press ⊞ Win + I . Pressed together, the Windows and uppercase "i" keys open the Settings menu.

steps.title: Click Privacy.
steps.content: Click Privacy . It's next to an icon of a padlock.

steps.title: Click Activity history.
steps.content: Click Activity history . You'll find this in the panel on the left side of the window. [5] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Click Manage my Microsoft account activity data.
steps.content: Click Manage my Microsoft account activity data . You may need to scroll down to find this at the very bottom of the window. Your Microsoft account activity history will open in a new browser window or tab. Enter your password to continue.

steps.title: Click a menu to learn more about that history.
steps.content: Click a menu to learn more about that history. There are menus for location, speech, browsing, and search histories. You can click Clear all history in each menu, but to quickly clear everything, go to Settings > Privacy > Activity History > Clear Activity History > Clear . [6] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source
